rustle:
沙沙的声音 
a quick series of soft, light sounds caused when things (such as leaves or pieces of paper) rub against each other

发出沙沙的声音 
to make a soft, light sound because parts of something are touching or rubbing against each other
merit:
良好品质，价值，有点 
the quality of being particularly good or worthy, especially so as to deserve praise or reward

值得，应受到 
to deserve or be worthy of (something, especially reward, punishment, or attention)
coercive:
用武力的；强制的；胁迫的 
using force or the threat of force
quiver:
抖动 
to shake because of fear, cold, nervousness, etc.; tremble

颤音 
a shaking sound, movement, or feeling that is caused by fear or other strong emotions
thermal:
热的 
of, relating to, or caused by heat
haul:
拉 
to pull or drag (something) with effort
punctuation:
标点符号 
the marks (such as periods and commas) in a piece of writing that make its meaning clear 
and that separate it into sentences, clauses, etc.
consent:
准许，同意 
to agree to do or allow something; to give permission for something to happen or be done

准许 
permission for something to happen or be done
antipathy:
厌恶；反感 
a strong feeling of dislike 
74
recoil:
退缩；畏缩 
to move your body quickly away from somebody/something because you find them or it 
frightening or unpleasant

因为不喜欢而拒绝，回绝，退避 
to react to an idea or a situation with strong dislike or fear

枪炮 反冲；产生后坐力 
(of a gun) move abruptly backward as a reaction on firing a bullet, shell, or other missile
supercilious:
傲慢的 
having or showing the proud and unpleasant attitude of people who think that they are 
better or more important than other people
temperate:
自我克制的 
(of weather conditions) neither very hot nor very cold
dagger:
匕首 
a sharp pointed knife that is used as a weapon
fathom:
理解，弄清真相 
to understand the reason for (something)
adjoin:
毗连，邻接 
to be next to or joined with something
divinity:
神圣 
the state of being a god
insidious:
暗中危害的 
causing harm in a way that is gradual or not easily noticed
shun:
避开 
to avoid (someone or something)
verifiable:
可证实的，可核实的 
capable of verification; that can be proved to be true or accurate
fluorescent:
荧光的 
producing light when electricity flows through a tube that is filled with a type of gas
census:
人口普查 
the official process of counting the number of people in a country, city, or town and 
collecting information about them 
75
antagonize:
使敌对，使对抗 
to cause (someone) to feel hostile or angry; to irritate or upset (someone)
discretion:
谨慎 
the ability to behave without causing embarrassment or attracting too much attention, 
especially by keeping information secret
insubordinate:
不服从的 
not obeying authority; refusing to follow orders
adept:
熟练的 
very good at doing something that is not easy

内行；能手 
a highly skilled or well-trained person; someone who is adept at something
enfeeble:
使衰弱，使无力 
to make feeble, to weaken
surmise:
猜测 
to form an opinion about something without definitely knowing the truth; guess
solitude:
孤独 
a state or situation in which you are alone usually because you want to be
overbearing:
专横的，傲慢的 
too confident and too determined to tell other people what to do, in a way that is unpleasant
sardonic:
讥讽的 
showing that you disapprove of or do not like someone or something; showing disrespect 
or scorn for someone or something
jubilant:
喜气洋洋的；欢欣鼓舞的；欢呼雀跃的 
feeling or showing great happiness because of a success
assuage:
减轻，缓解 
to make (something, such as an unpleasant feeling) less painful, severe, etc.
twinkle:
闪耀 
to shine with an unsteady light; to produce small flashes of light

眼睛 闪亮 
(of the eyes) to have a friendly or happy expression 
76
fastidious:
难取悦的 
liking few things; hard to please
dissident:
持不同政见者 
someone who strongly and publicly disagrees with and criticizes the government
millennium:
一千年 
a period of 1,000 years
rehabilitate:
使康复；使戒毒或戒酒；改造罪犯 
to bring (someone or something) back to a normal, healthy condition after an illness, 
injury, drug problem, etc.
coherence:
连贯性，一致性 
systematic or logical connection or consistency
flush:
脸红； 脸 发烫，发红 
(of a person's skin, face, etc.) become red and hot, typically as the result of illness or strong emotion

冲洗 
to cleanse something by causing large quantities of water to pass through it
gallant:
英勇的 
showing courage; very brave
heretic:
异端分子 
someone who believes or teaches something that goes against accepted or official beliefs
autograph:
名人 签名 
the signature of a famous person

在 上亲笔签名 
to write your signature in or on (something)
precaution:
预防措施 
something that is done to prevent possible harm or trouble from happening in the future
stupefy:
使震惊，使惊呆，使惊愕，使神志不清 
to surprise or shock somebody; to make somebody unable to think clearly
provisional:
临时的 
existing or accepted for the present time but likely to be changed 
77
wean:
使断奶 
to start feeding (a child or young animal) food other than its mother's milk

使戒除 
to make (someone or something) stop doing or using (something)
improvisational:
即兴的 
made up on the spur of the moment, done without advance preparation, unrehearsed, impromptu
overdrive:
汽车的超速挡 
an extra high gear in a vehicle, that you use when you are driving at high speeds

加倍努力或紧张 
to start being very active and working very hard
lethargic:
无精打采的 
feeling a lack of energy or a lack of interest in doing things
slippery:
滑的 
difficult to stand on, move on, or hold because of being smooth, wet, icy, etc.
choke:
窒息；哽噎 
to be unable to breathe because the passage to your lungs is blocked or you cannot get 
enough air; to make somebody unable to breathe

阻塞，塞满，堵塞 通道、空间等 
to block or fill a passage, space, etc. so that movement is difficult

窒息；哽噎；哽噎声；呛住的声音 
an act or the sound of choking
abominable:
讨厌的 
very bad or unpleasant
prophesy:
预言 
to state that something will happen in the future; predict
groan:
呻吟 
to make a deep inarticulate sound in response to pain or despair

发出嘎吱声 
(of a thing) make a low creaking or moaning sound when pressure or weight is applied

呻吟声 
a deep inarticulate sound made in pain or despair
monopoly:
垄断 
complete control of the entire supply of goods or of a service in a certain area or market
allay:
减轻尤指情绪 
to make something, especially a feeling, less strong 
78
lure:
引诱；诱惑；哄骗 
to tempt (a person or animal) to do something or to go somewhere, especially by offering 
some form of reward

诱惑物；诱惑；诱惑力；饵 
something that tempts or is used to tempt a person or animal to do something
trance:
出神，发呆 
a state in which you are not aware of what is happening around you because you are 
thinking of something else
resonate:
嗓音、乐器等产生共鸣；发出回响；回荡 
(of a voice, an instrument, etc.) to make a deep, clear sound that continues for a long time

使 回响，起回声 
(of a place) to be filled with sound; to make a sound continue longer

使产生联想；引起共鸣；和 的想法或观念类似 
to remind somebody of something; to be similar to what somebody thinks or believes
spiral:
螺旋形 
a circular curving line that goes around a central point while getting closer to or farther 
away from it

螺旋式移动 
to move in a circle around a central point while getting closer to or farther away from it; to 
move in a spiral
disparate:
多元的，迥然不同的 
different from each other
instigation:
煽动，教唆 
the act of causing something to happen or begin; the act of instigating something
idle:
生产停顿的，无事可做的 
not working, active, or being used

无所事事，空转 
to run without being connected for doing useful work
odious:
令人作呕的；令人讨厌的；可憎的 
extremely unpleasant
humble:
谦逊的 
not proud; not thinking of yourself as better than other people

使谦恭 
to make (someone) feel less important or proud; to make (someone) humble
sedition:
煽动叛乱的言论或行动 
the use of words or actions that are intended to encourage people to oppose a government 
79
providence:
上帝；苍天；天佑 
God, or a force that some people believe controls our lives and the things that happen to us, 
usually in a way that protects us
audible:
听得见的 
heard or able to be heard
exempt:
被豁免的 
not required to do something that others are required to do

豁免 
to say that (someone or something) does not have to do something that others are required to do
conjure:
施魔法召唤亡灵；变戏法般地创造出或消失 使 呈现于脑际；想象 
to make something appear by magic, or as if by magic; to bring to mind; to affect or effect by or 
as if by magic
unwittingly:
无意地，不经意地，不知不觉地 
in a way that shows you do not know or realize something
oscillation:
摆动；摇摆；振动 
a regular movement between one position and another or between one amount and another

情感、行为、思想的摇摆不定，变化无常，犹豫不定 
a repeated change between different feelings, types of behaviour or ideas
taunt:
嘲笑，讥讽 
to say insulting things to (someone) in order to make that person angry
mourn:
因失去 而 哀悼，忧伤 
to feel and show sadness because somebody has died; to feel sad because something no 
longer exists or is no longer the same
frenetic:
狂热的 
filled with excitement, activity, or confusion; wild or frantic
meridian:
子午线；经线 
one of the lines that is drawn from the North Pole to the South Pole on a map of the world
yap:
尤指小狗吠叫 
(especially of small dogs)to bark a lot, making a high, sharp and usually irritating sound

哇哩哇啦地胡扯 
to talk in a silly, noisy and usually irritating way
